intro: Excoecaria formosana, commonly known as the Formosan croton, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, lobed leaves that vary in color from green to reddish hues. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in complex inflorescences, which are typical of the genus Excoecaria. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
